Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis lid; interior glazed black with band in added red; exterior, from centre: part of four widely spaced rays; dot band (three rows of staggered dots) between pairs of black bands; black-figure decoration consisting of tail and part of back of goat and head and shoulder of panther, both to left (red on forehead and neck).
Producer name: Attributed to the Manner of: The Komast Group
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 339, no. B406)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0784) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 91, pl. I, no. 13)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
